list-item.label: a.
list-item.p: Abdominal distension is defined as a score of Likert-type scale at 24â€Šhours and fourth day after chemotherapy. Scores on Likert-type scale range from 1 to 5, with a score of 5 indicating no symptoms; a score of 1 indicating severe distension, interfering sleep (Table 2).

list-item.label: b.
list-item.p: The time of first defecation is recorded as a relatively objective indicator to describe the digestive function of participants.

list-item.label: c.
list-item.p: The World Health Organization Quality of Life scale will be performed on each patient once a month, 3 times in total.
